news_header: Netflix has raised its subscription prices in the UK, following increases in other countries, to invest in programming and enhance value for members.
news_original_title: Netflix raises subscription prices in UK
news_text: Netflix has increased its subscription prices in the UK, with the Standard plan rising by £2 to £12.99 per month. This follows recent price hikes in the US, Canada, Argentina, and Portugal. The price increases will affect all subscription plans, including the Standard plan with adverts and the Premium plan. Netflix aims to reinvest the additional revenue into programming and has reported record global subscriber numbers, surpassing expectations with nearly 19 million new subscribers in the last quarter of 2024. The company also noted a significant increase in net profit and sales during this period.
